alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 02 at 1:36PM PST until March 06 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM SATURDAY TO 4 AM PST MONDAY... * TRAVEL HAZARDS...Extreme travel disruptions possible. If you come to the Sierra this weekend, you may not be able to leave for a while. If you become stuck in your vehicle, rescue may be significantly delayed. * CHANGES...Upgraded from a Winter Storm Watch. * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet, except 2 to 4 feet above 7000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph, with up to 100 mph along the Sierra crest. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...From 10 AM Saturday to 4 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Strong winds may cause tree damage and lead to power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional snow loading on top of very deep existing snowpack may create unusual hazards including, but not limited to: structural instabilities, fire hydrant access problems, delayed first responders and shelter in place orders.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
